alert.note: Alert for Benewah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 02 at 9:21PM MST until March 06 at 5:48PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Idaho... St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. .Rain and melting snow will cause rises on the St Joe River. The St Joe River may exceed flood stage Friday. For the St. Joe River...including St Maries...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING TO SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...St Joe River at St Maries. * WHEN...From Friday evening to Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 32.5 feet, Minor flooding will occur throughout the low lying areas of the St Joe Valley. Water will be observed behind levees due to seepage. Minor flooding of the Aqua Park along the river`s edge. Outbuildings along the river that are not behind levees may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM PST Wednesday the stage was 28.5 feet. - The river is steadily rising. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late Friday evening. - Flood stage is 32.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning.Thursday morning at 800 AM PST.
